org.tantalum.j2me

Class TantalumMIDlet

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.microedition.midlet.MIDlet
      • org.tantalum.j2me.TantalumMIDlet

  • public abstract class TantalumMIDlet
extends javax.microedition.midlet.MIDlet
    This is a convenience class to embody the best practice patterns for starting and stopping an app which uses Tantalum. Using this class is optional, but makes your life simpler. You can either extend it, or implement your own variant.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected TantalumMIDlet()
      If you create a MIDlet constructor, you must call super() as the first line of your MIDlet's constructor.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void destroyApp(boolean unconditional)
      Do not call this directly.
      protected void pauseApp()
      Do nothing, not generally used
      void shutdown(boolean unconditional)
      Call this to close your MIDlet in an orderly manner, exactly the same way it is closed if the system sends you a destoryApp().

      • Methods inherited from class javax.microedition.midlet.MIDlet

        checkPermission, getAppProperty, notifyDestroyed, notifyPaused, platformRequest, resumeRequest, startApp

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • TantalumMIDlet

        protected TantalumMIDlet()
        If you create a MIDlet constructor, you must call super() as the first line of your MIDlet's constructor. Alternatively, you can call Worker.init() yourself with custom parameters for special needs.

    • Method Detail

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown(boolean unconditional)
        Call this to close your MIDlet in an orderly manner, exactly the same way it is closed if the system sends you a destoryApp(). Ongoing Work tasks will complete, or if you set unconditional then they will complete within 3 seconds.
        Parameters:
        unconditional -

      • destroyApp

        protected final void destroyApp(boolean unconditional)
        Do not call this directly. Call exitMidlet(false) instead. This is part of MIDlet lifecycle model and may be called by the platform, for example when a users presses and holds the RED button on their phone to force an application to close.
        Specified by:
        destroyApp in class javax.microedition.midlet.MIDlet
        Parameters:
        unconditional -

      • pauseApp

        protected void pauseApp()
        Do nothing, not generally used
        Specified by:
        pauseApp in class javax.microedition.midlet.MIDlet
